00029 // Something for all config_options to have in common.
00030 // From here we can call set_defaults for all config options
00031 // using the set_defaults static function.
00032 struct config_option_base
00033 {
00034         typedef std::vector< config_option_base* > registry_type;
00035         typedef registry_type::iterator registry_iterator;
00036         typedef registry_type::const_iterator registry_const_iterator;
00037 
00038         config_option_base( const char* key ) : key( key )
00039         {
00040                 registry.push_back( this );
00041         }
00042 
00043         ~config_option_base( )
00044         {
00045                 registry.erase( std::find( registry.begin(), registry.end(), this ) );
00046         }
00047 
00048         virtual handler_t set_defaults( const server& srv ) = 0;
00049         virtual handler_t set_defaults( ) = 0;
00050 
00051         static handler_t set_all_defaults( )
00052         {
00053                 for( registry_iterator i = registry.begin( ); i != registry.end( ); ++i )
00054                 {
00055                         if( (*i)->set_defaults( ) != HANDLER_ERROR ) continue;
00056                         return HANDLER_ERROR;
00057                 }
00058                 return HANDLER_GO_ON;
00059         }
00060 
00061         const char* key;
00062         const server* srv;
00063 
00064         static registry_type registry;
00065 };
00066 
00067 // Careful that we only get one of these per module.
00068 // i.e. only one translation unit.
00069 config_option_base::registry_type config_option_base::registry;
00070 
00071 // Traits for the config_values_type_t enum values from lighttpd base.h
00072 // These traits classes specify how the types should be initialized.
00073 template < std::size_t ConfigValuesType >
00074 struct config_values_traits
00075 {};
00076 
00077 // Keep a record of the T_CONFIG_* value in this base type
00078 template < std::size_t ConfigValuesType >
00079 struct config_values_traits_base
00080 {
00081         static const config_values_type_t config_values_type;
00082 };
00083 
00084 template < std::size_t ConfigValuesType >
00085 const config_values_type_t 
00086 config_values_traits_base< ConfigValuesType >::config_values_type( ConfigValuesType );
00087 
00088 // derive from this if we just use the default constructor
00089 // Its annoying that we have to re-typedef things in derived
00090 // classes but it seems that we do in gcc.  I haven't checked the 
00091 // standard on this.  If it is a standard, then it enables overloading of
00092 // types to an extent.
00093 template < typename Type, std::size_t ConfigValuesType >
00094 struct config_values_traits_default
00095  : config_values_traits_base< ConfigValuesType >
00096 {
00097         typedef Type value_type;
00098 
00099         struct initializer
00100         {
00101                 typedef value_type result;
00102                 static result* act( )
00103                 {
00104                         return new result( );
00105                 }
00106         };
00107 
00108         struct cleanup
00109         {
00110                 typedef bool result;
00111                 static result act( value_type* pvalue )
00112                 {
00113                         delete pvalue;
00114                         return true;
00115                 }
00116         };
00117 };
00118 
00119 // We need a traits class for each of these types:
00120 // typedef enum { T_CONFIG_UNSET,
00121 //              T_CONFIG_STRING,
00122 //              T_CONFIG_SHORT,
00123 //              T_CONFIG_INT,
00124 //              T_CONFIG_BOOLEAN,
00125 //              T_CONFIG_ARRAY,
00126 //              T_CONFIG_LOCAL,
00127 //              T_CONFIG_DEPRECATED,
00128 //              T_CONFIG_UNSUPPORTED
00129 //} config_values_type_t;
00130 
00131 template <>
00132 struct config_values_traits< T_CONFIG_STRING >
00133  : config_values_traits_base< T_CONFIG_STRING >
00134 {
00135         typedef buffer value_type;
00136 
00137         struct initializer
00138         {
00139                 typedef value_type result;
00140                 static result* act( )
00141                 {
00142                         return buffer_init( );
00143                 }
00144         };
00145 
00146         struct cleanup
00147         {
00148                 typedef bool result;
00149                 static result act( value_type* pvalue )
00150                 {
00151                         buffer_free( pvalue );
00152                         return true;
00153                 }
00154         };
00155 };
00156 
00157 template <>
00158 struct config_values_traits< T_CONFIG_SHORT >
00159  : config_values_traits_default< short, T_CONFIG_SHORT > {};
00160 
00161 template <>
00162 struct config_values_traits< T_CONFIG_INT >
00163  : config_values_traits_default< int, T_CONFIG_INT >
00164 {
00165         typedef config_values_traits_default< int, T_CONFIG_INT > super_type;
00166         typedef super_type::initializer initializer;
00167         typedef super_type::cleanup cleanup;
00168 };
00169 
00170 template <>
00171 struct config_values_traits< T_CONFIG_BOOLEAN >
00172  : config_values_traits_default< unsigned short, T_CONFIG_BOOLEAN > {};
00173 
00174 template <>
00175 struct config_values_traits< T_CONFIG_ARRAY >
00176  : config_values_traits_base< T_CONFIG_ARRAY >
00177 {
00178         typedef array value_type;
00179 
00180         struct initializer
00181         {
00182                 typedef value_type result;
00183 
00184                 static result* act( )
00185                 {
00186                         return array_init( );
00187                 }
00188         };
00189 
00190         struct cleanup
00191         {
00192                 typedef bool result;
00193 
00194                 static result act( value_type* pvalue )
00195                 {
00196                         array_free( pvalue );
00197                         return true;
00198                 }
00199         };
00200 };

00204 {
00205 };

00208 struct config_values_traits< T_CONFIG_DEPRECATED >

00217 // The traits class gives us a mapping from OptionType to the associated
00218 // lighttpd enum T_CONFIG_* values.  Using this we can select a method of
00219 // conversion from buffer/array/etc to our OptionType.
00220 // OptionType must have a constructor that takes i.e. buf->ptr or array->data etc
00221 template < typename OptionType, std::size_t ConfigValueType >
00222 struct config_option_traits_base
00223 {
00224         static const config_values_type_t value_enum;
00225         typedef config_values_traits< ConfigValueType > values_type_traits;
00226         typedef typename values_type_traits::value_type value_type;
00227         typedef OptionType option_type;
00228 
00229         // A default initializer.  We can do this in gcc, not sure if it
00230         // is standard.
00231         struct initializer
00232         {
00233                 typedef option_type result;
00234                 static result* act( const value_type* pvalue )
00235                 {
00236                         return new option_type;
00237                 }
00238         };
00239 };
00240 
00241 template < typename OptionType, std::size_t ConfigValueType >
00242 const config_values_type_t config_option_traits_base< OptionType, ConfigValueType >
00243 ::value_enum( static_cast< config_values_type_t >( ConfigValueType ) );
00244 
00245 template < typename OptionType >
00246 struct config_option_traits
00247 {};
00248 
00249 // Configure some default types
00250 template <>
00251 struct config_option_traits< std::string > : config_option_traits_base< std::string, T_CONFIG_STRING >
00252 {
00253         // templating seems to mean we have to pull typedefs down
00254         typedef config_option_traits_base< std::string, T_CONFIG_STRING > super_type;
00255         typedef super_type::value_type value_type;
00256         typedef super_type::values_type_traits values_type_traits;
00257         typedef std::string option_type;
00258 
00259         struct initializer
00260         {
00261                 typedef option_type result;
00262                 static result* act( const value_type* buf )
00263                 {
00264                         return new option_type( buf->ptr );
00265                 }
00266         };              
00267 };
00268 
00269 template <>
00270 struct config_option_traits< int > : config_option_traits_base< int, T_CONFIG_INT >
00271 {
00272         typedef config_option_traits_base< int, T_CONFIG_INT > super_type;
00273         typedef super_type::initializer initializer;
00274 };
00275 
00276 template <>
00277 struct config_option_traits< short > : config_option_traits_base< short, T_CONFIG_SHORT >
00278 {
00279         typedef config_option_traits_base< short, T_CONFIG_SHORT > super_type;
00280         typedef super_type::initializer initializer;
00281 };
00282 
00283 template <>
00284 struct config_option_traits< bool > : config_option_traits_base< bool, T_CONFIG_BOOLEAN >
00285 {
00286         typedef config_option_traits_base< bool, T_CONFIG_BOOLEAN > super_type;
00287         typedef super_type::initializer initializer;
00288 };

00290 // For now I'll just allow vectors of string.  A boost::any would be nice here maybe.
00291 // I'd like to try and stay in with the people are thinking I'm nuts including boost
00292 // in here, but I think I'm already through the looking glass so I'll probably end up
00293 // going all out with the templating and boost inclusion.
00294 template <>
00295 struct config_option_traits< std::vector< std::string > >
00296  : config_option_traits_base< std::vector< std::string >, T_CONFIG_ARRAY >
00297 {};

00299 // The config_option structures deal with condition decisions so we can write
00300 // option[ con ] where option is a L(config_option< SomeType >), con is a L(connection) 
00301 // and get back the appropriate L(OptionType) option from the "defaults" memeber data.
00302 template <      typename OptionType, 
00303                         std::size_t ConfigScopeType = T_CONFIG_SCOPE_CONNECTION,
00304                         typename OptionTraits = config_option_traits< OptionType > >
00305 struct config_option : public config_option_base
00306 {
00307         typedef std::vector< const OptionType* > defaults_list_type;
00308         typedef typename defaults_list_type::const_iterator defaults_iterator;
00309         typedef OptionTraits option_traits;
00310         typedef typename option_traits::values_type_traits values_type_traits;
00311 
00312         typedef bool (*validator_type)( const OptionType& );
00313         typedef bool (*defaults_setter_type)( OptionType& );
00314 
00315         config_option(  const char* key,
00316                                         validator_type val = 0,
00317                                         defaults_setter_type def = 0 )
00318          : config_option_base( key )
00319         { }
00320 
00321         virtual handler_t set_defaults( )
00322         {
00323                 return set_defaults( *srv );
00324         }
00325 
00326         virtual handler_t set_defaults( const server& s )
00327         {
00328                 // initializer defines the method that the lighttpd
00329                 // config type should be created with, before it is
00330                 // passed to config_insert_values_global.
00331                 typedef typename values_type_traits::initializer initializer;
00332                 typedef typename initializer::result initializer_result_type;
00333 
00334                 typedef typename values_type_traits::cleanup cleanup;
00335                 typedef typename cleanup::result cleanup_result_type;
00336 
00337                 // next be have information how the data structure created
00338                 // with the above should be converted to our chosen option type.
00339                 typedef typename option_traits::initializer option_initializer;
00340 
00341                 srv = &s;
00342                 config_values_t cv[] = {
00343                         { key,  NULL, option_traits::value_enum, static_cast< config_scope_type_t >( ConfigScopeType ) },
00344                         { NULL, NULL, T_CONFIG_UNSET, T_CONFIG_SCOPE_UNSET }
00345                 };
00346 
00347                 for( std::size_t i = 0; i < s.config_context->used; i++ )
00348                 {
00349                         initializer_result_type* res = initializer::act();
00350                         cv[0].destination = reinterpret_cast< void* >( res );
00351 
00352                         if ( 0 != config_insert_values_global( const_cast< server* >( srv ), 
00353                                                         ((data_config *)srv->config_context->data[i])->value, cv) )
00354                         {
00355                                 return HANDLER_ERROR;
00356                         }
00357 
00358                         // Initialize option, but don't take control of the 
00359                         // res memory allocation ( i.e. just make a copy and leave as is )
00360                         OptionType* option = option_initializer::act( res );
00361                         if( ( validator && defaults_setter ) && !validator( *option ) )
00362                                 defaults_setter( *option );
00363                         defaults.push_back( option );
00364 
00365                         // Although we don't do anything with the result,
00366                         // I'll keep the option available
00367                         cleanup_result_type cleanup_result = cleanup::act( res );
00368                 }
00369 
00370                 return HANDLER_GO_ON;
00371         }
00372 
00373         // Return the appropriate value for the options, depending on the 
00374         // server and connection.
00375         const OptionType& operator[]( const connection& con ) const
00376         {
00377                 // Lets start with the global context.  Front must exist.
00378                 // Plus I'd hope that config_context->used and the size of
00379                 // defaults are the same.
00380                 defaults_iterator di = defaults.begin();
00381                 const OptionType* option = *di;
00382                 const data_config** dc = ++((data_config **)srv->config_context->data);
00383 
00384                 // skip the first, the global context
00385                 while( di != defaults.end() )
00386                 {
00387                         // condition match
00388                         if( config_check_cond( srv, &con, *dc ) )       
00389                         {
00390                                 // merge config
00391                                 data_unset **du = (*dc)->value->data;
00392                                 data_unset **du_end = du + (*dc)->value->used;
00393                                 while( du++ != du_end )
00394                                 {
00395                                         if ( buffer_is_equal_string( (*du)->key, CONST_STR_LEN(key) ) )
00396                                         {
00397                                                 option = *di;
00398                                         }
00399                                 }
00400                         }
00401 
00402                         ++dc; ++di;
00403                 }
00404 
00405                 return *option;
00406         }
00407 
00408         validator_type validator;
00409         defaults_setter_type defaults_setter;
00410         defaults_list_type defaults;
00411 
00412         static const config_scope_type_t config_scope;
00413 };
00414 
00415 // Record what type of config we are
00416 template < typename OptionType, std::size_t ConfigScopeType, typename OptionTraits >
00417 const config_scope_type_t config_option< OptionType, ConfigScopeType, OptionTraits >
00418 ::config_scope( static_cast< config_scope_type_t >( ConfigScopeType ) );
